revision.text:
{{Use dmy dates|date=June 2018}} {{Infobox football biography | name = Naby Keïta | image =Testspiel Rasenballsport Leipzig gegen FC Liefering (9.August 2016) 11.jpg | image_size = | caption = Keïta with [[RB Leipzig]] in 2016 | fullname = Naby Laye Keïta<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bundesliga.com/en/news/Bundesliga/naby-keita-10-things-on-rb-leipzig-s-liverpool-bound-guinea-midfielder-473425.jsp |title=Naby Keita: 10 things on RB Leipzig's Liverpool-bound Guinea midfielder |publisher=Bundesliga |accessdate=1 June 2018}}</ref> | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1995|2|10|df=y}}<ref name=Soccerway/> | birth_place = [[Conakry]], Guinea | height = 1.72 m<ref name=Soccerway/> | position = [[Central midfielder]] | currentclub = [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] | clubnumber = 8 | youthyears1 = 2004–2012 | youthclubs1 = [[Horoya Athlétique Club|Horoya]] | years1 = 2013–2014 | clubs1 = [[FC Istres]] | caps1 = 23 | goals1 = 4 | years2 = 2014–2016 | clubs2 = [[FC Red Bull Salzburg|Red Bull Salzburg]] | caps2 = 59 | goals2 = 17 | years3 = 2016–2018 | clubs3 = [[RB Leipzig]] | caps3 = 58 | goals3 = 14 | years4 = 2018– | clubs4 = [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] | caps4 = 20 | goals4 = 0 | nationalyears1 = 2013– | nationalteam1 = [[Guinea national football team|Guinea]] | nationalcaps1 = 31 | nationalgoals1 = 5 | club-update = 23:24, 28 February 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = 16 October 2018 }} '''Naby Laye Keïta''' (born 10 February 1995) is a Guinean professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[central midfielder]] for [[Premier League]] club [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] and [[Captain (association football)|captains]] the [[Guinea national football team|Guinea national team]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.liverpoolfc.com/news/first-team/273590-liverpool-agree-deal-to-sign-naby-keita|title=Liverpool agree deal to sign Naby Keita|publisher=Liverpool Football Club|date=29 August 2017|accessdate=29 August 2017}}</ref>
Keïta began his professional career with [[Ligue 2]] club [[FC Istres]] in 2013, and a year later he moved to [[FC Red Bull Salzburg|Red Bull Salzburg]], where he won the [[Austrian Football Bundesliga]] and [[Austrian Cup]] [[Double (association football)|double]] in both of his seasons. He then moved to [[RB Leipzig]] in 2016, making the [[Bundesliga]] team of the season in his first year and the [[UEFA Europa League]] squad of the season in his second.
Keïta made his senior international debut for Guinea in 2013. He has earned over 30 [[Cap (sport)|caps]] and was part of their squad at the [[2015 Africa Cup of Nations]].
==Club career== ===FC Istres=== Keïta joined hometown club [[Horoya AC]] aged nine.<ref name="Ten things on RB Leipzig's new African star Naby Keita">{{cite web|title=Ten things on RB Leipzig's new African star Naby Keita|url=http://www.bundesliga.com/en/news/Bundesliga/noblsp-ten-things-on-rb-leipzigs-new-african-star-naby-keita.jsp|website=Bundesliga|accessdate=18 December 2016}}</ref> He moved to France in 2012, joining the youth team of [[FC Istres]] after unsuccessful trials at [[FC Lorient]] and [[Le Mans FC]].<ref name="Ten things on RB Leipzig's new African star Naby Keita" />
In 2013, he was promoted to the first team of Istres. He made his [[Ligue 2]] debut on 22 November 2013 against [[Nîmes Olympique]].<ref name="soccerway2">{{cite web|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2013/11/22/france/ligue-2/football-club-istres-ouest-provence/nimes-olympique/1479823/|title=Istres vs. Nîmes – 22 November 2013 |publisher=Soccerway|accessdate=28 July 2014}}</ref> He scored 11 goals in 23 games in his first season as a professional, while his team were relegated to the [[Championnat National]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Ligue 2 table.|url=http://www.lfp.fr/ligue2/classement#sai=82&journee1=1&journee2=38&cat=Gen}}</ref>
===Red Bull Salzburg=== [[File:Audi quattro-Cup (11. Juli 2015) 07.JPG|thumb|upright|Keïta with [[FC Red Bull Salzburg|Red Bull Salzburg]] in 2015]]
In 2014, he joined Austrian top division side [[FC Red Bull Salzburg|Red Bull Salzburg]].<ref name="Ten things on RB Leipzig's new African star Naby Keita" /> He made his league debut on 26 July 2014 against [[SC Wiener Neustadt|Wiener Neustadt]].<ref name="soccerway3">{{cite web|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2014/07/26/austria/bundesliga/fc-magna-wiener-neustadt/fc-red-bull-salzburg/1692303/|title=Wiener Neustadt vs. Red Bull Salzburg – 26 July 2014 |publisher=Soccerway|accessdate=28 July 2014}}</ref> Keïta ended the season with five goals and two assists in 30 games, winning the league and cup double. The following season, he was selected as the Austrian Bundesliga Player of the Year.
===RB Leipzig=== In June 2016, Keïta moved to Red Bull Salzburg sister-club [[RB Leipzig]], who had just been promoted to the German [[Bundesliga]].<ref name="Ten things on RB Leipzig's new African star Naby Keita" /><ref>[http://www.salzburg.com/nachrichten/oesterreich/sport/fussball/sn/artikel/fussball-naby-keita-wechselt-von-salzburg-zu-leipzig-201595/ Fußball: Naby Keita wechselt von Salzburg zu Leipzig], salzburg.com, 20 June 2016</ref> He scored the winner on his league debut against [[Borussia Dortmund]]<ref>{{cite news |agency=Associated Press |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2016/sep/10/leipzig-borussia-dortmund-bundesliga-match-report |title=Leipzig get first Bundesliga win with Keïta goal against Borussia Dortmund |newspaper=The Guardian |date=10 September 2016 |accessdate=26 June 2017}}</ref> and scored seven more goals in his debut Bundesliga season. He was named in the league's team of the season.<ref name=bundesliga/>
Keïta was named in the squad of the season for the [[2017–18 UEFA Europa League]], in which his team were quarter-finalists.<ref name=europa/>
===Liverpool=== On 28 August 2017, a deal was struck for Keïta to join [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] on 1 July 2018 after the English club triggered his £48 million release clause in addition to paying an undisclosed premium.<ref>{{cite news|title=Naby Keita: Liverpool agree club-record deal for Leipzig midfielder for July 2018|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/41075272|accessdate=28 August 2017|publisher=BBC News |date=28 August 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Liverpool agree deal to sign Naby Keita|url=http://www.liverpoolfc.com/news/first-team/273590-liverpool-agree-deal-to-sign-naby-keita|accessdate=29 August 2017|publisher=Liverpool FC|date=29 August 2017}}</ref> There would be no premium (£48 million total) if Leipzig did not qualify for European football, £4.75 million (£52.75 million total) if they qualified for the [[UEFA Europa League|Europa League]] and £11 million (£59 million total) if they finished in the [[UEFA Champions League|Champions League spots]].<ref>{{cite news|title=RB Leipzig's Season Finish Could Wind Up Increasing Liverpool's Fee for Naby Keita|url=https://www.si.com/soccer/2017/12/14/contract-clause-revealed-will-force-liverpool-pay-more-rb-leipzig-star-naby-keita|accessdate=14 December 2017|website=Sports Illustrated|date=14 December 2017}}</ref> Leipzig finished 6th in the Bundesliga, qualifying for the Europa League.
Upon joining Liverpool he was handed the number 8 shirt by Liverpool legend [[Steven Gerrard]] which had been vacated upon the departure of Gerrard to [[LA Galaxy]] in 2015.<ref>{{cite news|title=Naby Keita: Steven Gerrard handed me the No.8 jersey|url=https://www.liverpoolfc.com/news/first-team/305366-naby-keita-steven-gerrard-number-eight|accessdate=14 December 2018|website=Liverpool FC|date=27 June 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Naby Keita Was Handed The Number 8 Shirt By Steven Gerrard|url=http://www.sportbible.com/football/football-news-naby-keta-reveals-the-brilliant-way-he-was-handed-the-number-8-jers-20180627|accessdate=14 December 2018|website=SPORTbible|date=27 June 2018}}</ref> Keïta made his debut for Liverpool against [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] on 12 August 2018 and played a part in the opening goal for [[Mohamed Salah]] in a 4–0 win.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Naby Keita impressed for Liverpool on his debut against West Ham |first=Adam |last=Bate |work=Sky Sports |date=13 August 2018 |accessdate=16 September 2018 |url= https://www.skysports.com/football/news/12028/11471028/naby-keita-impressed-for-liverpool-on-his-debut-against-west-ham}}</ref>
==International career== On 28 July 2013, Keïta made his international debut for the [[Guinea national football team|Guinea national team]] against [[Mali national football team|Mali]] in a [[2014 African Nations Championship qualification]] match. He came on as a half-time substitute for [[Naby Laye Camara]] in the 1–0 home win.<ref name=nft>{{cite web |title=Keïta, Naby |url=https://www.national-football-teams.com/player/53218/Naby_Keita.html |publisher=National Football Teams |accessdate=4 November 2018}}</ref>
He was included in [[Michel Dussuyer]]'s 23-man squad for the [[2015 Africa Cup of Nations]] in Equatorial Guinea.<ref>{{cite news |title=2015 Nations Cup: Constant included in Guinea squad |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/30636144 |accessdate=4 November 2018 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=31 December 2014}}</ref> In the opening match against the [[Ivory Coast national football team|Ivory Coast]], he was struck in the face by [[Gervinho]], who was sent off.<ref>{{cite news |title=Afcon 2015: Two-match ban as Gervinho apologises for red card |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/30907505 |accessdate=4 November 2018 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=21 January 2015}}</ref>
On 12 November 2015, he scored his first international goal, the only one away to [[Namibia national football team|Namibia]] in [[2018 FIFA World Cup qualification – CAF Second Round|the first leg of the second round]] of [[2018 FIFA World Cup qualification]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Coupe du monde 2018 : la Guinée s’en sort bien en Namibie|trans-title=2018 World Cup: Guinea travel well in Namibia |url=http://afriquefoot.rfi.fr/20151112-football-coupe-monde-2018-eliminatoires-namibie-guinee-luis-fernandez |accessdate=4 November 2018 |publisher=RFi |date=12 November 2015 |language=French}}</ref> Three days later in the return leg – in Morocco due to the [[Ebola virus epidemic in Guinea]] – he scored again in a 2–0 win.<ref>{{cite news |title=CM 2018 : La Guinée confirme et se qualifie|trans-title=WC 2018: Guinea confirm and qualify |url=http://www.afrik-foot.com/cm-2018-la-guinee-confirme-et-se-qualifie |accessdate=4 November 2018 |publisher=Afrik Foot |date=15 November 2015 |language=French}}</ref>
==Document falsification charges== In autumn 2017, Keïta was charged with uttering false documents. The German newspaper ''[[Bild]]'' reported that, in early December 2016 and again six weeks later, he had presented two fake Guinean driver's licences in order to obtain a driving licence in Germany. The district court in Leipzig ''(Amtsgericht Leipzig)'' fined him €415,000 to be paid in 50 daily instalments of €8,300, basing the sentence on Keïta's net annual income of around €3 million. Keïta's lawyer filed an appeal against the sentence which was to come on before the same court in 2018.<ref>{{cite news|title=Leipzig-Star soll ein Vermögen an Strafe zahlen|url=https://www.welt.de/sport/article170393361/Leipzig-Star-soll-ein-Vermoegen-an-Strafe-zahlen.html|accessdate=8 November 2017|newspaper=Die Welt|date=7 November 2017}}</ref>
==Style of play== Keita has been described as a dynamic, box-to-box central midfielder. He is able to distribute the ball with range and accuracy, score goals frequently and has been compared to [[N'Golo Kanté]] and [[Deco]].<ref>{{cite news |author=Nick Ames and Nick Miller |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2016/dec/28/rising-stars-10-players-watch-2017 |title=Rising football stars: 10 players to watch in 2017 |newspaper=The Guardian |date=28 December 2016 |accessdate=26 June 2017}}</ref>
==Career statistics== ===Club=== {{updated|match played 19 February 2019}}<ref name=Soccerway>{{cite web |title=N. Keïta: Summary |url=https://uk.soccerway.com/players/naby-deco-keita/323155/ |website=Soccerway |publisher=Perform Group |accessdate=6 December 2018}}</ref>

Bundesliga |29||12||5||2||colspan="2"|—||3<ref group=lower-alpha>Two appearances in the [[UEFA Champions League|Champions League]] and one in the [[UEFA Europa League|Europa League]]</ref>||0||colspan="2"|—||37||14 |- !colspan="2"|Total !59!!17!!9!!2!!colspan="2"|—!!13!!1!!0!!0!!81!!20 |- |rowspan="3"|[[RB Leipzig]] |[[2016–17 RB Leipzig season|2016–17]] |[[Bundesliga]] |31||8||1||0||colspan="2"|—||colspan="2"|—||colspan="2"|—||32||8 |- |[[2017–18 RB Leipzig season|2017–18]] |Bundesliga |27||6||2||1||colspan="2"|—||10<ref group=lower-alpha name="UEL">Appearances in the [[UEFA Champions League|Champions League]]</ref>||2||colspan="2"|—||39||9 |- !colspan="2"|Total !58!!14!!3!!1!!colspan="2"|—!!10!!2!!0!!0!!71!!17 |- |rowspan="2"|[[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] |[[2018–19 Liverpool F.C. season|2018–19]] |[[Premier League]] |19||0||1||0||1||0||4<ref group=lower-alpha name="UEL"/>||0||0||0||25||0 |- !colspan="2"|Total !19!!0!!1!!0!!1!!0!!4!!0!!0!!0!!25!!0 |- !colspan="3"|Career total !159!!35!!13!!3!!1!!0!!27!!3!!0!!0!!200!!41 |}

==Honours== '''Red Bull Salzburg''' *[[Austrian Football Bundesliga]]: [[2014–15 Austrian Football Bundesliga|2014–15]], [[2015–16 Austrian Football Bundesliga|2015–16]] *[[Austrian Cup]]: [[2014–15 Austrian Cup|2014–15]], [[2015–16 Austrian Cup|2015–16]]
'''Individual''' *[[Bundesliga]] Team of the Season: 2016–17<ref name=bundesliga>{{cite web | url = http://www.bundesliga.com/en/bundesliga-tv/official-bundesliga-team-of-the-season-2016-17-video-445402.jsp | title = Official Bundesliga Team of the Season for 2016/17 | publisher = bundesliga.com | date = 26 May 2017 | accessdate = 4 June 2018}}</ref> *[[UEFA Europa League]] Squad of the Season: [[2017–18 UEFA Europa League#Squad of the Season|2017–18]]<ref name=europa>{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuropaleague/news/newsid=2560036.html|title=UEFA Europa League Squad of the 2017/18 Season|publisher=UEFA|date=17 May 2018}}</ref> *[[CAF Team of the Year]]: 2018<ref>{{cite news|title=Salah and Mane Picked in First Africa Best 11 |url=https://fifpro.org/news/salah-mahrez-and-mane-in-first-africa-best-11/en/|publisher=FIFPro |date=8 January 2019|accessdate=8 January 2019}}</ref>
